channel.title: Blogs on Julian Swart
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Julian Swart

item.title: Data Engineering is Cool Too
item.description: In our day jobs, my colleague and I have spent most our time working in the business-facing world of data science. This project was an effort to deepen our understanding of the entire data process, mainly within the more hidden world of data engineering. To do this, we decided to simulate the transaction, customer, and product data of a fake business, which we called JJ Furnitiure (JJ stands for Jon and Julian). Check out what we learned…

item.title: Web Scraping The Big Rock: A Famous Fishing Tournament
item.description: Michael Jordan enters this tournament - there’s $6M in overall prize money - it’s a big deal! I have been web scraping the data from this tournament’s website for the past 5 years and in this post I will demonstrate how I do that using Python. Afterwards, I dig into the data and make some plots using R. Let’s get fishy üêü
